object.name: Player
object.description:
Creates a player clone if placed in a level. That clone mimics all of the player's actions, including grabbing and throwing objects (underwater as well) and swimming. It also seems that the clone's voice always has priority over the main player's voice. Punching, kicking or ground-pounding the clone hurts the player, but stomping him does not hurt the player. The clone does not seem to always interact with other objects right, namely, he will go through certain (random) objects.
[b]Parameters (standard):[/b] Need to be documented better. Parameter 1 does affect character the clone is. If you set Parameter 1 to 0001, he loads as a mario, but when hit turns into Luigi. If you set it to 0002, loads as Mario but when hit turns into Wario. 0003 loads as Mario, gets hit, turns into Yoshi. 0004 seems to be same as 0001. 0005 loads as mario, but when hit freezes the game. 0006 loads as Mario, and when hit, turns invisible. The invisible character can still walk around and interact with things, but I can't tell what character it is. (Mario, Luigi, Yoshi, Wario..?)
Parameters 2 and 3 do nothing.

param.name: Clone appearance
param.description: Which character the clone will be, and which hat he will come up with.

object.description: An icy hexagonal platform from Chief Chilly Challenge - fight.
A layer of ice platforms that Chief Chilly destroys after 2nd hit.
A layer of ice platforms that Chief Chilly destroys after 1st hit.

object.name: Large ice platform
object.description: A large block of ice that continally moves along a set path.

param.name: Path ID
param.description: The ID of the path to follow.

object.name: Moving Log
object.description: Moves up and down.

object.name: Up-down lift platform
object.description:
A lift platform that follows an up-and-down loop path, allowing the player to reach higher places.
[b]Parameters (standard):[/b] 1: start position (2 = ?, 7 = ?) 2: X rotation for the platform 3: Z rotation for the platform

object.name: Moving Platform
object.description: Used in VS Main.

object.name: Chain Chomp
object.description: A Chomp chained to a ground-poundable wood pole. When freed, runs into [object=0033] then disappears.

object.name: Seesaw platform
object.description: Large seesaw platform.

object.name: Boulder
object.description:
Iron boulder. Rolls along a set path, but respects gravity no matter where the path goes. Explodes when hitting an obstacle such as a wall.
TODO: figure out parameters.

object.name: Giant Rolling Rock
object.description:
Used in Hazy Maze Cave. Parameter 1:
Star ID followed by:
00 - Spawn many, rolling, without a star, while player isn't close. 01 - Spawn many, rolling, with a star, while player isn't close 02 - Spawn one, rolling, without a star, without looking at player distance 03 - Spawn one, rolling, with a star, without looking at player distance 04 - Spawn one, not rolling, with a star. Later same as 02
Set Star ID to FF if you do not want a star to spawn when breaking the rock, eg. FF04 will spawn a stationary rock that does nothing when broken.

object.name: Goomba
object.description:
That well-known enemy from SMB.
Parameter 1: XYZA where:
X = Unknown Y = Determines when the cap should be spawned: 0 - Never, 1 - If the character already unlocked, 2 - Even if character not unlocked Z = 0 - Spawn coin when defeated, 1 - Spawn coin when defeated + Silver Star A = Cap to spawn. 0 - Mario, 1 - Luigi, 2 - Wario, F - None
FFFF = Normal

object.name: Goomboss
object.description: Encountered in Goomboss Battle.

object.name: Bob-Omb
object.description:
That bomb enemy from SMB2. Can be picked up and thrown. If grabbed underwater, the player can carry it like a green Koopa Shell. Even though shell swimming has a timer, the Bob-omb will explode before the time is up. It can also be thrown underwater.
Parameter1: 1 - Doesn't walk (it still moves it's legs and can be kicked). 5 - Chases Player and then explodes.

object.name: Pink Bob-Omb
object.description: Pink, peaceful Bob-Omb buddy. Tells the associated message when the player talks to them.

object.name: Koopa
object.description: Well-known enemy from SMB. Can be kicked out of its shell, and awards a blue coin if killed while shellless. Eat the red variation for one-off fire breath. And kick the red shell to knock out enemies, like when you eat a green shell.

param.name: Color
param.description: What color the Koopa will be.

object.name: Small Koopa
object.description: Found in the small area of Tiny Huge Island.

object.name: Orange Brick Block
object.description: Those big, orange brick block cubes. Anyone but Yoshi can break them.

object.name: Large orange brick block
object.description: Larger version of [object=0017].

object.name: Power Flower
object.description: Appears when a Red ? Box is destroyed. When placed into a level, only appears when the player is Luigi. Collecting a Luigi cap does not make the Power Flower suddenly appear.

object.name: ? Switch
object.description: Turns ? Blocks Solid and allows you to save.

object.name: Small Wooden Box
object.description: Can be carried, thrown, eaten, burned, stood upon, and broken. If grabbed underwater, the player can carry it for a limited time like a Green Shell underwater with shell-surfing music playing. Underwater, it can be thrown as well.

object.name: Cannon Hatch
object.description: Covers unactivated cannons.

object.name: Red ? Block
object.description:
Releases a Power Flower when it explodes.
Parameter 1: Contents: 0 = Nothing 101 = Star 300 = 3 coins 500 = 5 coins FF00 = Single coin FF02 = 1-up Mushroom FF03 = Green Shell FF04 = Super Mushroom FF05 = Wingcap for Mario / Power Flower for rest FF06 = Power Flower FF07 = Lit Bob-omb for Mario / Power Flower for rest

object.name: Yellow Item Block
object.description:
Can award coins, 1UPs, a Star, or a Koopa Shell.
Parameter1: Contains: 0 = Nothing 1 = Star 2 = 1-up (fades away quickly) 3 = Green Shell (fades away quickly) 4 = Super Mushroom (fades away quickly) 5 = Feather for Mario / Nothing for everyone else 6 = Power Flower 7 = Angry Bob-omb

object.name: VS. Item Block
object.description: Yellow ! Box used in multiplayer mode. Spawns a feather any player can use to fly.

object.name: Mario hat box
object.description:
A box that gives out a Mario hat when hit.
This object is unused in the game, but is present in the general purpose test map, and fully functional. Character must be unlocked or the level contain a corresponding hat through Object 254.

object.name: Wario hat box
object.description:
A box that gives out a Wario hat when hit.
This object is unused in the game, but is present in the general purpose test map, and fully functional. Character must be unlocked or the level contain a corresponding hat through Object 254.

object.name: Luigi hat box
object.description:
A box that gives out a Luigi hat when hit.
This object is unused in the game, but is present in the general purpose test map, and fully functional. Character must be unlocked or the level contain a corresponding hat through Object 254.

object.name: Wooden pole
object.description: Small wooden pole that can be groundpounded to obtain coins.

object.name: Coin
object.description:
Standard, yellow coin. Every 50 coins collected earn the player one life upon successfully finishing the stage.
Parameter 1: 0 - Disappear after a few seconds. 1/75 - Appear permanently until collected.

object.name: Red coin
object.description:
Worth two yellow coins. When 8 red coins are collected, a star appears.
[b]Important note:[/b] Do not place more than 8 red coins in a level. Collecting more than 8 red coins freezes the game.
Parameter 1:
Set to the Star ID followed by: 0 - Appear only temporarily 1 - Appear permanently until collected

object.name: Blue coin
object.description:
Worth 5 yellow coins. Appears when ground-pounding an associated [object=0131], or when killing certain enemies.
Parameter 1:
0 - Appear only temporarily 1 - Activated by a Blue Coin Switch.

object.name: Bowser
object.description: Parameter 1: 0 - Dark World Behaviour Patterns 1 - Fire Sea Behaviour Patterns 2 - Sky Behaviour Patterns (Can only be used in Sky - Fight)

object.name: Tree
object.description:
Standard tree that can be climbed.
[b]Warning:[/b] using two different tree types in the same level crashes the game.

object.name: Painting
object.description:
Jump-through paintings in the castle. Needs an exit to work properly. Parameter1: Painting/size
Units: width from 0 to F 16s: height from 0-F 4096s,256s: painting from 00-12
PAINTINGS: 0= Bob-omb Battlefield 1= Whomp's Fortress 2= Jolly Roger Bay (Bubbles) 3= Cool Cool Mountain (Snowmen) 4= Hazy Maze Cave (Silver Pool) 5= Lethal Lava Land (Evil Face) 6= Shifting Sand Land (Stone Wall) 7= Dire, Dire Docks (Blue Shimmer) 8= Snowman's Land (Pale Wallpaper) 9= Wet-Dry World (Skeeter Enemy) A= Tall, Tall Mountain B= Mountain Slide (Rocky Wall) C= Tiny-Huge Island (Goombas) D= Tick Tock Clock (Clock Face) E= Goomboss Battle (Mario) F= Big Boo Battle (Luigi) 10= Cheif Chilly Challenge (Wario) 11= Battle Fort [Unused] (Early Top-down View of the Battle Fort) 12= Sunshine Isles
other paintings are an individual object (such as OBJ 275) or part of the level model.
e.g. 0134 painting 01, height 3, width 4 0168 painting 01, height 6, width 8 ie bigger

object.name: Red ! Switch
object.description:
When pressed, makes Red ? Blocks become solid and usable.
XXXY where:
X - Unknown, FF0
Z - Mode: 0 - Switch permanently 1 - Unable to switch on? 2 - Switch on SW_BLOCK_L with a timer 8 - Open SW_BLOCK_L without timer
Set Parameter 1 of the (ID 25) SW_BLOCK_L bricks to FF00

object.name: Star Switch
object.description:
Makes a star inside a cage appear.
The first two digits of Parameter 1 give the time limit (seconds / 2 possibly) and the second two give the ID of the Star.

object.name: Switch controlled fence
object.description: A fence door that opens when the associated switch is activated. Never closes if associated to a timed switch, even after the switch timer runs out.

object.name: Tall Grate Wall
object.description: Used in Hazy Maze Cave.

object.name: Control Pad Platform
object.description: Platform in Hazy Maze Cave. Walking onto the arrows makes the platform move in their direction.

object.name: Loose Chain Chomp
object.description: A Chain Chomp that isn't attached to a pole, and instead wanders around following a set path (and usually carries a Power Star attached to its chain).

object.name: 1UP Mushroom
object.description: Green mushroom that gives the Player an extra life.

object.name: Cannon
object.description: When touched, allows the player to aim, then press the attack button to blast out.

object.name: Chain Chomp Fence
object.description: The fence [object=000A] runs into when freed. In Bob-Omb Battlefield, it is used to prevent access to the 7th star. However, Vanish Luigi can go through it.

object.name: Water Bomb
object.description: Falling bubbles that harm the player and some enemies.

object.name: Birds
object.description: Birds that fly away when a player walks near them. Mostly decorative.

object.name: Fish
object.description: Small fish swimming around. Purely decorative.

object.name: Butterflies
object.description:
Butterflies flying around.
Parameter 1: 21 - Spawn 3, 2 turn into cannonballs when touched, one turns into 1UP 75 - Spawn 5 1F - Spawn 3, one turns into 1UP 2F - Turns into cannonball

object.name: King Bob-omb
object.description:
King of the bob-ombs, can be found on top summit of Bob-omb Battlefield.
Parameter 1: FF followed by the Star ID.
Notes: - The behaviour of King Bob-Omb is hard-coded to match the Star ID with which the level was entered, ie.: Star 1 - Fight 1, Star 4 - Fight 2. - King Bob-Omb's position in a level is hard-coded to only work properly if placed at -2.998, 4.192, -4.597
Important: Using King Bob-Omb requires that the level contains a Bob-Omb object (can be hidden under level), otherwise during behaviour 1, after throwing a couple of Bob-Ombs, all subsequent Bob-Ombs will have totally corrupted textures. Reason for this is unknown.

object.name: Snowman
object.description: Appears out of nowhere and throws snowballs at the player. Can be defeated by running circles around it.

object.name: Mad Piano
object.description: Chomps at the player as long as it is in range.

object.name: Pirhana Plant
object.description:
Classic enemy from SMB.
Sleeps most of the time, but if a player comes too close, wakes up and starts chomping.

This sprite determines where the camera should be placed while a star is spawning.
Parameter 1:
Star ID

object.name: Power Star
object.description:
Adds 1 star to the player's star counter when collected. Not all secret Stars end the level.
Parameter 1: XY where:
Y - Star ID X - Mode 0: Normal 1: Jumping around (Like if you defeat an enemy with a Silver Star) 5: Always yellow, but not collectable if already collected? 6: Appears as glass sphere, can be spawned by silver stars

object.name: Silver Star
object.description:
When 5 Silver Stars are collected, makes a Star appear inside a cage. If one or more Silver Stars are dropped, the caged star will disappear until they are collected again.
Parameter 1: Star ID, X: should correspond to a Power Star with Parameter 1 set to 6X

object.name: Star marker
object.description:
Tells where the associated Power Star lands after it spawns.
Optionally, this object can show a horizontal star shadow at its position, usually when the star is spawned by collecting red coins.
Parameter 1: Where X is the Star ID:
X - Used for Red Coins, appears as blue rotating horizontal star 1X (also: 3X, 5X, 7X, 9X, BX...) - If set to this, it appears invisible, and nothing seems to spawn a star. Star Switches set to this ID will appear already pressed. 2X, AX - Star can be spawned by events like Koopa the Quick, numbered "secrets" or from a baddie being beaten. 4X - Appears as the Star Switch glass sphere, but won't spawn stars from Switch Stars, baddies nor silver stars? 6X - For Switch Stars, appears as glass sphere

object.name: Whomp
object.description: Walks in a straight path, then turns around and walks the other way. When it finds a player, it moves faster.

object.name: Whomp King
object.description:
Takes 3 hits to destroy.
Parameter 1: FF followed by Star ID eg. FF01 for Star 1.
There should be a corresponding Star Marker with Parameters 2 followed by Star ID, eg. 21 for Star 1.

object.name: Thwomp
object.description: An angry stone that smashes the ground, then returns to it's initial position.

object.name: Boo
object.description:
Chases the player. Turns translucent when looked at, revealing an object inside.
Parameter 1: 0 - Normal 1 - Stays still, doesn't turn transparent, cannot be defeated or stomped but can be eaten which triggers the usual line "You can't eat ghosts" and can be pushed around by walking into it. 2 - Slightly erratic chasing movement, triggers "ghosts don't die" text, otherwise normal 3 - Spawns two of the Para1:1 ghosts in the same place 4/FF04 - Transparent, slightly bigger, flies away forever after being approached. Used in castle corridor. 5/FF05 - Big Boo's Haunt cage, like it was just spawned. 6 - Appears normal? 7 - Spawns three Boos, one of them may be Param. 1/2 behaviour. 8 - Doesn't chase or turn transparent, but moves in a circle, otherwise normal. 9/10 - Appears normal, needs investigation? A/FF0A - Contains yellow coin instead of blue coin B - Doesn't spawn 100 - Wears Luigi Cap

object.name: Big Boo
object.description:
The Boo's larger brethren. Takes 3 hits to destroy and releases a Power Star.
Parameter 1: 0 - Normal 1 - Does not appear to spawn. Needs investigation. 2 - Spawns when all Para1:2 Boos are defeated. 3 - King Boo (may require object LUIGI to function) 4 - Stays still, doesn't turn transparent, cannot be defeated or stomped but can be pushed around by walking into it. 5 - same as 4 500 - Appears when approached, needs Star Marker to spawn star.

object.name: Large Mansion Steps
object.description: These appear after defeating Big Boo in the mansion.

object.name: Bookshelf Switch
object.description: The books sticking out of the bookshelf. They activate a door.

object.name: Big Boo's Merry-Go-Round
object.description: Big Boo's Merry-Go-Round. Rotating platform. Also plays its own music when the player is close enough to it.

object.name: BBH Flipping Platform
object.description: Flipping platform in Big Boo's Haunt.

object.name: Wall Sign
object.description: Signs inside the castle are mounted on walls. Press A to read them.

object.name: Sign post
object.description: Wooden sign post. When close to it, the player can press A or B to read its message. Wario can stand behind a sign and press A to pick it up and carry it, then press A again to throw it. If placed underwater, Wario can grab these from behind and ride them like Koopa Shells underwater.

param.name: Message ID
param.description: The ID of the message to be read.

object.name: CCM Ice Square
object.description: Used in Cool, Cool Mountain.

object.name: Seaweed
object.description: Seen in some water levels like Jolly Roger Bay.

object.name: Healing Heart
object.description: The Healing Heart heals your life, to fullife/power.

object.name: Toad
object.description: Toad, in-game. Some Toads give you Power Stars. The parameters for Toad's message are the same as those for Bob-omb Buddy.

object.name: Princess Peach
object.description:
Princess Peach in-game. If you stand in front of her and press A or B, she says the following.
"That's just fine--I've been looking for something to fry with my fire breath! Your Star Power is useless against me! Your friends are all trapped in the walls... And you'll never see the princess again! Gwa ha ha ha!"
This might be because she was never intended to talk, but was given this behavior to prevent crashing.

object.name: Koopa Shell
object.description:
The green Koopa Shell can be ridden on/under water and on land, while its red counterpart can be hit to send it flying across the ground. Red shells can be eaten by Yoshi to allow him to breathe fire. Green shells can be eaten by Yoshi, then spat out to travel as a Red Shell does when hit.
Set Parameter 1 to 10 for underwater riding.

param.name: Color
param.description: What color the shell will be.

object.name: Shark
object.description: Swims around very fast, taking three life points if a player hits it. Like Cheep-Cheep, it cannot be killed in any way.
Unused triangular version of CT_MECHA01 from Tick Tock Clock.

Unused rotating triangular platform from Tick Tock clock. Shaped like a segment of a hexagon, rotates about Y (up) axis and has a raised bump at the centre (inner point of triangle). Uses the same shadow as CT_MECHA06.
Unused cube-shaped platform from Tick Tock Clock. Moves up and down continuously. No shadow. Shares same behaviour as CT_MECHA08B.
Unused cube-shaped platform from Tick Tock Clock. Moves up and down continuously. Shares same behaviour as CT_MECHA08A.

object.name: Caged Platform (Pyramid)
object.description: Caged platform that appears in Shifting Sand Land - pyramid.

object.name: SSL Pyramid Top
object.description: Explodes when each of the four triggers (DL_PYRAMID_DUMMY) are touched by the player.

object.name: SSL Pyramid Trigger
object.description: When all 4 are triggered, make the tip of the pyramid (DL_PYRAMID) explode.

object.name: Sliding Pole
object.description:
Sliding poles that appear in Dire Dire Docks.
Parameter 1 gives the ID (zero-based index) of the path the pole is to follow.

object.name: Donut Block (Rainbow Ride)
object.description: Platform that begins to fall after the player walks on it, from Rainbow Ride.
Swinging pendulum-like platform from Rainbow Ride.
Seesaw platform from Rainbow Ride.

Spinning platform (Y axis) from Rainbow Ride.
Parameter 1 should be FFFF. Parameter 3 should be 0 for Counter-Clockwise, FEC9 for Clockwise.
Clockwise spinning platform with 'arms' from Rainbow Ride.

object.name: Giant Log
object.description: Moves when the player walks on it.

Breakable rock at entrance to Wiggler's Cave in Tiny Huge Island - Tiny.
Use FFFF.

Water above entrance to Wiggler's Cave. Lowers and disappears when entrance broken.
Use FFFF.

Tiny Huge Island - Huge breakable entrance to Wiggler's Cave. Disappears when entrance broken in Tiny island.
Use FFFF.

Tiny Huge Island - Huge water above entrance to Wiggler's Cave. Lowers and disappears when entrance broken in Tiny island.
Use FFFF.

object.name: Square Wood Platform
object.description: A square wood platform which floats on water.

object.name: Arrow Lift (Wet Dry World)
object.description: It moves when you stand on it.

object.name: Water Level Diamond
object.description:
Chances the water level to the level of the diamond.
used in Wet Dry World.

object.name: Platform For Cage (Lift)
object.description: Used in Wet Dry World

param.name: If working
param.description: FF00 for Lift. FF01 for Static object

object.name: Rectangular Wood Platform
object.description: A rectangular wood platform which floats on water.
The rotating ring around the volcano in Lethal Lava Land.

The little bridge that goes up and down from Lethal Lava Land.
The name seems to be an interesting reference to London bridge.
Adds a 'popping lava bubbles' effect to each plane with either LETHAL LAVA or LETHAL ICE collision applied.

object.name: Scuttle Bug
object.description: Black/yellow spider that walks around. When it sees a player, it runs directly at them, much faster than when it walks. Releases 3 coins when killed.

object.name: Spiny
object.description: Classic enemy from SMB. It is a red spiny Koopa that walks on all fours. This enemy will simply bounce backwards when hit with any attack, even being rammed into with a green Koopa Shell. The only way to kill a Spiny is to hit it with a Yoshi Egg.

object.name: Lakitu
object.description: Throws Spinies which are in the same object bank.

object.name: Money Bags
object.description: Disguised as a coin, this enemy appears to be harmless. When approached, it turns into a purse, then hops away. When hit, it releases many coins.

object.name: Mr. I
object.description: Stays in one place, constantly looking at the player. Every 5 seconds or so, it fires a plasma ball at the player. It can be defeated by running circles around it. Releases a blue coin when killed.

object.name: Big Mr. I
object.description:
Huge version of Mr. I seen in the attic in Big Boo's Haunt. It acts the same way as its smaller counterpart, but releases a Power Star when defeated, as opposed to a blue coin.
Parameter 1: Star ID

object.name: Crazed Crate
object.description: When grabbed or eaten, makes the player do a triple jump while diving. If watched closely while idle, the block will hop up and down. If grabbed underwater, the player can carry it like a Koopa Shell.

object.name: Amp
object.description:
Black, electric ball that moves around in a circle. When touched, the player will be electricuted and stunned for a second. Metal Wario will not take damage, and Invisible Luigi can walk through them.
Parameter 1:
(Diameter of Amp's path) * 10

object.name: Monkey Cage Star
object.description: A Power Star inside a monkey cage. The monkey sets it free.

object.name: Ukiki (Thief)
object.description: Steals the player's hat, making them more vulnerable to enemies.

object.name: Ukiki (Star)
object.description: Releases the Power Star from the monkey cage.

object.name: Baby Penguin
object.description:
The baby penguin.
Param 1: 0 - Real 1 - Fake

object.name: Mother Penguin
object.description:
Bring her the correct baby and she will reward you with a star.
Param 1: Star ID
Special note: Its position in the level affects where she looks down at player; level needs to be high enough or low enough so it looks right.

object.name: Bridge Penguin
object.description: Walks back and forth across the bridge on the snowman.

object.name: Racing Penguin
object.description: The one that races you in Cool, Cool Mountain - slider.

object.name: Fire Chomp
object.description: When it sees a player, it constantly looks at them. Occasionally, it will puff up twice as large, then it will spew a fireball that follows the player.

object.name: Cheep Cheep
object.description: Fish that appears in Dire, Dire Docks. It swims around.

object.name: Skeeter
object.description: Enemies that slide on top of the water in Wet Dry World. If a Skeeter is stuck between the water and a floating platform, it dies.

Coffin from Big Boo's Haunt.
Parameter 1: 0 - Raise up when jumped on 1 - Do not move

object.name: Fwoosh the Cloud
object.description: An enemy that resembles a cloud with a face. It floats in one spot, trying to blow the player's hat away, and even the player itself.
Pillar of rock that falls over on Player from JRB.

object.name: Rock Triangle (JRB)
object.description: A rock triangle only solid on top.

object.name: Rock Chunk (JRB)
object.description: A piece of rock used as decoration in Jolly Rodger Bay. Lit. Name = Something_Rock.

object.name: Warp pipe
object.description:
That green warp pipe from every Mario game.
Does nothing if placed alone. For it to act as an entrance or an exit, the corresponding objects must be placed inside it.
Sign with left facing arrow from Bob-Omb Battlefield.
Sign with right facing arrow from Bob-Omb Battlefield.

object.name: Fly Guy
object.description:
Flying Shy Guy that swoops down to attack the player.
Set Parameter 1 to 0 for swoop-to-attack behaviour. Set Parameter 1 to 1 to also spit fire at Player.

object.name: Bullet Bill
object.description: When launched from a Bullet Bill Box (KILLER_DAI) home in on a player and follow them. It can be defeated with a well-timed attack.

object.name: Bowser Orange Ball
object.description: Orange balls placed around the arena in Bowser in the Dark World - Battle.

object.name: Bullet Bill Box
object.description: Fires Bullet Bills if the player is in range and in plain sight.

object.name: Stood-up plank
object.description: If kicked, it will fall flat, ignoring all collision. From Whomp's Fortress.

object.name: Fragile Bridge (Whomp's Fortres)
object.description: Falling bridge blocks from Whomp's Fortress.
Breakable wall at bottom of Tower from Whomp's Fortress.

Non-breakable version of BK_KABE00 wall from Whomp's Fortress from "Blast Away The Wall".
Note: The collision map for this object should be scaled by 8 - reason unknown.

Breakable wall from Whomp's Fortress from "Blast Away The Wall". Destroyed when Player hits it after being fired from cannon. Parameter 1: FF followed by ID of Star, eg. FF01 for Star 1
A Star marker should exist with Parameter of 2 followed by Star ID. eg. 21 for Star 1.
Note: The collision map for this object should be scaled by 8 - reason unknown.

object.name: Tower
object.description: Large tower from Whomp's Fortress.
Floating rotating island from Whomp's Fortress.

Moving steps used to climb the Tower in Whomp's Fortress.
Parameter 1: FFFF - No movement FF01 - Move in and out FF02 - Move up and down
Chunk of wall (small) that move in and out in Whomp's Fortress. Rotation does not work correctly, direction of movement cannot be changed.
Chunk of wall (large) that move in and out in Whomp's Fortress. Rotation does not work correctly, direction of movement cannot be changed.
Platforms that move in and out from Whomp's Fortress. Can be rotated.

Parameter 1:
Byte 1: 0 - Arrow platform, follows paths, starts moving on touch 1 - Metal Grate Platform, follows paths, starts moving on touch 2 - Crashes
Byte 2: Path ID
Rectangular platform that moves along its longer side.

object.name: Castle basement pillar (switch)
object.description: When two of them have been groundpounded, the water level in the castle's moat is lowered, making the 'Secret under the Moat' level accessible.

object.name: Fire Guy Fireball
object.description: Fireball shot by Fly Guys with Parameter 1 set to 1.

object.name: Bowser Spikeball
object.description: Explodes when touched, taking two wedges of the player's health. If Bowser comes in contact with these, he will be damaged.

object.name: Hoot the Owl
object.description: Appears when the player climbs into his tree. While holding B, the player can fly around holding him.

object.name: Bully
object.description: Tries to push the player into the lava. When killed, throws a coin at the player.

object.name: Big Bully
object.description: A bigger version of the Bully. When defeated, a Power Star appears.

object.name: Invisible Pole
object.description:
A pole. However, it is invisible.
Parameter 1: XXYY where:
XX - Whether the player can perform a handstand at the top; 00 - No, 01 - Yes YY - (Height of the pole * 100) (in hex).

object.name: Lakitu Bro.
object.description: A Lakitu that holds a camera on a fishing line. It can be seen in the mirror room.

object.name: Pushable block
object.description: A large metal block that the player can push. Can't be pushed off edge of platform, no ground detection.

object.name: Floating Lava Grate
object.description:
A moving metal grate seen in Lethal Lava Land and Bowser in the Fire Sea.
Param 1: XYZ
X -?
Y - Start Moving 0 - From level start 1 - When touched
Z - Path ID

object.name: Snufit
object.description: A type of Shy Guy that shoots bullets out of its mouth.

object.name: Monty Mole
object.description: A mole in a hole that throws rocks at the player. Reappears when killed.

object.name: Monty Mole Rock
object.description: A rock which Monty Mole throws at the player.

object.name: Swooper
object.description: Bats in Hazy Maze Cave. They swoop down and try to hurt the player.

object.name: Heave Ho
object.description: A robot with a panel that follows the player. When it touches them, it throws them into the air.

object.name: Klepto the Condor
object.description: A bird that tries to steal the player's hat. If the player is Yoshi, or has no hat, Klepto will try to attack them.

object.name: Pokey
object.description: A cactus-like enemy that tries to slide into the player.

object.name: Mario's Hat
object.description: This hat turn your current character into Mario.

object.name: Bowser Puzzle Piece
object.description: A puzzle piece in Lethal Lava Land.

object.name: Dorrie
object.description: A dinosaur in the Underground Lake. It swims around, and can be "piloted" like a boat.

object.name: Dorrie's Cap
object.description: Most likely the Wario Cap that Dorrie wears, considering this object is named DOSSY_CAP, and Dorrie is DOSSY.

object.name: Spindrift
object.description: A flower-like enemy in Snowman's Land and Cool Cool Mountain. It tries to float into the player, and it can also float on water.

object.name: JRB ship's sliding box
object.description: Box that slides on the Jolly Roger Bay ship (when it is afloat). Players can walk on it, but get hurt if they touch it on any side.

object.name: Unagi the Eel
object.description:
A giant eel in Jolly Roger Bay. It swims around, but takes 3 life points if touched.
Set Parameter 1 to 2 followed by the path ID then 00 if it is to behave as in 'CAN THE EEL COME OUT TO PLAY'. Set Parameter 1 to F followed by the path ID then 00 if it is to swim about following a path.

object.name: Clam
object.description: A clam. It opens when the player gets close, but closes after 5 seconds. It can hurt the player while it is closed.

object.name: Red Flame
object.description: Basically a torch.

object.name: Blue Flame
object.description: A blue flame. Seen in the basement.
Spawns a 1UP Mushroom if its location is the same as that of a Brick Block or Big Brick Block when the block is destroyed.

object.name: Block Super Mushroom Tag
object.description:
Spawns a Super Mushroom if its location is the same as that of a Brick Block or Big Brick Block when the block is destroyed.
Parameter 1: 7F
Spawns a Green Shell if its location is the same as that of a Brick Block or Big Brick Block when the block is destroyed.
Spawns a Silver Star if its location is the same as that of a Brick Block or Big Brick Block when the block is destroyed.
Flying Carpet from Rainbow Ride. Parameter 1: First two digits should be 06, second to specify the path ID (zero-based index) the carpet is to follow.

object.name: Big Key
object.description:
Big key spawned by bosses upon their defeat.
Parameter1: 0 - Bowser Key 1 - Bowser Key 2 - Mario Key 3 - Luigi Key 4 - Wario Key 5 - Big Star Key

object.name: Last Star
object.description:
Spawns a large star similar to the one awarded when Bowser is defeated for the final time. Touching it gives the player wings, and upon landing, the player teleports to 0.000, 0.000, 0.000 and executes the "super triple jump" animation, then flies around for a few seconds, finally triggering the ending. Some parameters might yield a key from the first two fights.
Setting Parameter 1 to FFFF causes it to work the same as when Bowser is defeated and trigger the ending sequence.

object.name: Eyerok
object.description:
Boss in Shifting Sand Land - pyramid. It uses its hands to attack, and can be killed by hitting the eye on each hand 3 times.
PARAM 1: XYYY X - Star ID
This object will only activate if you stand on it or the area around it in specific coordinates in Shifting Sand Land's Pyramid, and nowhere else.

object.name: Wiggler
object.description: A caterpillar that tries to run over the player. When defeated, a Power Star appears, and Wiggler falls.

object.name: Koopa the Quick
object.description:
A large Koopa that challenges the player to several races. He will follow the path specified in Parameter2, he does detect collision and will jump across edges automatically.
Parameter2: ID (zero-based index) of the path he follows

object.name: Koopa Flag
object.description: The flag that appears when racing Koopa the Quick.

object.name: Big Boo's Haunt Entrance
object.description: Entrance to Big Boo's Haunt.

object.name: Black Brick Block
object.description: Only Wario can break this.

object.name: Killer Book
object.description: Chomps and flies at the player.

object.name: Book Generator
object.description: It generates books which will be shooted

object.name: Ice Bully
object.description: A large Ice Bully that tries to push the player into cold water. When defeated, a Power Star appears.

object.name: Treasure Chest
object.description:
A treasure chest.
Parameter 1: XXYY where:
XX - The Star ID, for the first chests this is FF, for the final chest this should be the Star ID and match the Star ID of a Star Marker YY - The order of the current chest.

object.name: Castle grounds water
object.description:
The water box used in Castle grounds.
Appears lower than its position if the two pillars in the castle basement have been groundpounded.

object.name: Possessed Chair
object.description: A chair that flies at the player.

object.name: Metal Grate
object.description: Blocks off the cannon and several other locations.
Little stairs.
Rope barrier.

object.name: Castle flag
object.description: A red and white flag, like the ones present on Peach's castle's roof. Purely decorative object.

object.name: Spindel
object.description: A round, mummified Thwomp that rolls back and forth trying to roll over the player.

object.name: Chuckya
object.description: A large purple enemy that tries to grab the player and throw them. It can also be grabbed and thrown. If grabbed underwater, the player can carry it like a green Koopa Shell. However, after a few seconds, the Chuckya will automatically "throw" itself and die. The player can also throw it underwater.

object.name: Super Mushroom
object.description:
A mushroom that makes the player huge, stomping everything in their way. If the player is huge and falls into water, the player acts as if they were Metal Wario.
Parameter 1: 0 - Like spawned from block F1 - Not there F2 - Flies away when approached F3 - Still, doesn't disappear F4 - Mushroom jumps before you touch

object.name: Invisible Secret
object.description:
When touched, a number appears. Touching 5 reveals a Star.
Parameter 1: F followed by Star ID, eg. F05 for Star 5.
There should be a Star Marker with parameters 2 followed by Star ID eg. 25 for Star 5.

object.name: Blue Coin Switch
object.description:
Makes Blue Coins appear for a limited time.
Parameter 1: XYZA where:
X : When the time remaining is low, start ticking faster? 0,F - Yes Other - No
Y : Time limit, (seconds * 2)?
Z : Unknown, zero
A : Spawn Coin? 0 - Yes Other - No

object.name: Number GFX
object.description:
Shows a number that quickly disappears, just like the numbers that appear when collecting red coins.
Alone, not a really useful object.

param.name: Digit
param.description: Digit from 0 to 9 to be shown.

object.name: CCM slide shortcut detector
object.description: In the Cool, Cool Mountain penguin slide, detects when the player takes the shortcut. Plays the 'secret found' sound effect, but, during races, also tells the racing penguin that the player is cheating.

object.name: Manta Rings
object.description: Rings from Manta.

object.name: Giant Venus Firetrap
object.description: Giant fire-breathing Piranha Plant that grows into visibility when approached.

object.name: Tiny Venus Firetrap
object.description: Tiny fire-breathing Piranha Plant that grows into visibility when approached.

object.name: Hidden Piranha Plant
object.description: A hidden Piranha Plant that grows into visibility when approached.

Makes ENEMY_CREATE function when player steps in the area it defines.
Parameter 1: XY where:
X - 2: Spawn continuously whilst player within area Y - ID of this ENEMY_SWITCH, increments from 0 for each ENEMY_SWITCH within level, used by corresponding ENEMY_CREATE
Parameter 2: Size of area, default 1.
Parameter 3: Spawn delay, in frames, 0 is the default, FFFF.

Spawns Bob-ombs when player steps into an ENEMY_SWITCH. Bob-ombs do not have to be in the loaded level overlays.
Parameter 1: Unknown, FFC0
Parameter 2: Unknown, 0
Parameter 3: XXY where:
XX - Unknown, 3E Y - ID of corresponding ENEMY_SWITCH

object.name: SSL Tornado
object.description: Will appear when the player is a certain distance from it, or closer. Respawns a few seconds after disappearing.

object.name: Fire ring
object.description:
Possibly a fire ring. This object's actor code is contained in an overlay that isn't loaded via the regular system. Possibly, it is loaded and used as a sub-object by another object, and isn't meant to be used alone.
[b]Do not use, for it will crash the game.[/b]

object.name: Ambient Sound Effects
object.description: Plays sound effects when player gets close. Param 1: XY X - ? Y: 1 - Birds 2 - Birds 3 - Different birds 4 - Birds with very quiet waterfall 5 - Bird with waterfall 6 - Loud waterfall 7 - Nothing 8 - Waterfall on right speaker
Changes background music. Need proper combination of current level music and a correct param to switch properly. For instance: Jolly Roger Bay's music + Param 1: 71 = Jolly Roger Overworld music
Used to play sound effects upon entering a level.
